Icons are stored in the icons directory inside the system resources directory. Icons may be placed in nested directories inside the icons folder. Profiles may have their own icons directory that can be loaded to extend the application icons pool, it will override repeated icons.
There is a configuration file called `icons.xml` that defines an icon "key" for each icon path. In this file icons are separated by types. There are five possible icon types: ``` document repository archetype app main_menu ```
Each type can be interpreted as a dictionary with multiple keys, each key give access to the icon file path. In order to add an icon to a type it must be done using the following xml syntax `<icon key="icon_key" file="path/to/file.extension" />`. Each type may have a default icon in case a non-existent key is accessed. Example: `<type name="archetype" default="default-archetype.png"/>`
Archetypes repositories may have their own icons directory. It must be called `icons` and it must be placed at the root of the archetype repository. Repository icons configuration file `icons.xml` can only contain `document` and `archetype` type icons. It may override the default icon for each type.
